Description: Group of nine gold beads now strung together; hammered into a biconical shape from metal sheet and soldered at the edges; three plain, five fluted, and one with impressed dots; all have spiral-beaded wire rings around the perforations, missing from one of the plain examples.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: In the register the object is said to come 'from a tomb (102?)' on Site D.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2019)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 81, Tomb 102 no. 4; Pl. XIII, fig. 27)
